{{Infobox video game | title = Railway Empire | image = | developer = {{Unbulleted list|[[Gaming Minds Studios]]}} | publisher = [[Kalypso Media]] | platforms = {{Unbulleted list|[[Microsoft Windows]]|[[Linux]]|[[PlayStation 4]]|[[Xbox One]]}} | released = {{Video game release|EU|January 26, 2018|NA|January 30, 2018}} | genre = [[Tycoon-simulation game|Simulation-adventure]] | modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] }} '''Railway Empire''' is a tycoon simulation game released on 26 January 2018 for [[Playstation 4]], [[Xbox One]], [[Personal computer|PC]] and [[Linux]]. The game was developed by the German studio Gaming Minds Studios and produced by [[Kalypso Media]].<ref>{{cite web |title=About Railway Empire |url=https://www.gamespot.com/railway-empire/ |website=GameSpot |accessdate=8 July 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.polygon.com/2017/11/12/16640810/railway-empire-launch-date-pc-ps4-xbox-one|title=Railway Empire comes to consoles and PC in January|publisher=}}</ref> In [[Japan]], the physical copy of the game was distributed by [[Ubisoft]] in May 2018.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.play-asia.com/blog/2018/03/19/build-your-own-train-empire-in-railway-empire-coming-to-japan/|title=Railway Empire in Japan|publisher=}}</ref>
==Gameplay== The game takes place in the [[United States]] from 1830 up to 1930. In Railway Empire, the player can build a large network of railway lines and buy various [[locomotives]]. The game has several game modes like campaign mode, scenario mode, free mode and sandbox mode.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.pcgamer.com/railway-empire-is-a-mostly-satisfying-management-sim/|title=Railway Empire is a mostly satisfying management sim|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2018/02/13/wot-i-think-railway-empire/|title=Wot I Think: Railway Empire|date=13 February 2018|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.gamestar.de/spiele/railway-empire/wertung/54751.html|title=Railway Empire (PC) - Wertung, Fazit - GameStar|website=www.gamestar.de}}</ref>
In the campaign mode, the player plays against different competitors. In the Scenario mode, these competitors are selectable and playable characters with specific gameplay bonuses. In total, six different characters are present in Railway Empire:<ref>{{cite web|url=https://gameplay.tips/guides/2098-railway-empire.html|title=Railway Empire - Complete Guide|website=Gameplay.tips}}</ref> * Roger Smythe - The Industrialist. * Doc Murphy - The Engineer. * Beatrix von Pomp - The Lady. * Tricia Jones - The Trickster. * Johnathan Johnson - The General. * Don Lorenzo - The Gangster.
==Reception== The game has a score of 74 on [[Metacritic]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/railway-empire|title=Railway Empire|website=Metacritic}}</ref>
==DLC and updates== Railway Empire’s support and development continues even after its release. The game has received several free features and updates, as well as a range of other fixes and improvements.<ref name="Mexico DLC PS4 Review">{{cite web |title=Mexico DLC (PS4) Review |url=http://www.gamepitt.co.uk/railway-empire-mexico-dlc-ps4-review/ |website=Game Pitt |accessdate=8 July 2018}}</ref> In addition, some DLCs are in development. Here is the list:
{|class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- !DLC Title !Released !Region !New locomotives |- !scope="row" rowspan="1"|Mexico<ref name="Mexico DLC PS4 Review"/> |8 Jun, 2018 |Mexico |Fairlie (0-6-6-0) and Stirling (4-2-2) |-
!scope="row" rowspan="1"|The Great Lakes<ref name="steamcommunity.com">{{cite web |title=New Development Roadmap Released! Review |url=https://steamcommunity.com/games/503940/announcements/detail/1684792419467643211 |website=steamcommunity |accessdate=19 August 2018}}</ref> |17 Aug, 2018 |Canada |Achilles (0-4-0) and Canadian (2-8-0) |-
!scope="row" rowspan="1"|Crossing the Andes<ref name="steamcommunity.com"/> |19 Oct, 2018 |South America |Kitson-Meyer (0-8-6-0) and Garratt (2-6-0-0-6-2) |-
!scope="row" rowspan="1"|Great Britain & Ireland<ref name="GB IR">{{cite web |title=Next Stop: Europe! - New Development Roadmap Released! |url=https://steamcommunity.com/games/503940/announcements/detail/2749905327308968130 |accessdate=6 November 2018}}</ref> |N/A |Great Britain & Ireland |N/A |-
!scope="row" rowspan="1"|Germany<ref name="GB IR"/> |N/A |Germany |N/A |-
!scope="row" rowspan="1"|France<ref name="GB IR"/> |N/A |France |N/A |- |}
==Awards and nominations== Railway Empire has been nominated 4 times by the [[Deutscher Entwicklerpreis]] 2018, the most important Video game award from German speaking countries!<ref>{{cite web |title=Deutscher Entwicklerpreis 2018: Die Nominierten |url=https://www.gameswirtschaft.de/events/deutscher-entwicklerpreis-2018-nominierungen/ |website=gameswirtschaft.de |accessdate=6 November 2018}}</ref> Nominations: '''Best German Game''', '''Best PC/Console Game''', '''Best Graphics''', '''Best Technical Performance'''.
Railway Empire has been nominated by TOMMI - Der deutsche Kindersoftwarepreis 2018<ref>{{cite web |title=TOMMI - Der deutsche Kindersoftwarepreis 2018 |url=http://www.kindersoftwarepreis.de/ |website=kindersoftwarepreis.de |accessdate=6 November 2018}}</ref>

{{Unreferenced|date=March 2009}} A '''small cap company''' is a company whose [[market capitalization]] ([[share (finance)|share]]s x value of each share) is small, under $1 billion.
==Overview==
A small cap company typically has under $1 billion under control and are hence considered small companies. Small companies generally are not able to secure the best ([[prime rate|prime]]) borrowing rates and wield reduced power, including a smaller [[market share]]. Being small, they are also less financially stable than larger companies, and are more likely to become [[bankrupt]]. However, they do generally have more [[growth potential]] and over time have greater but more volatile expected returns.
== See also ==
* [[Market capitalization]]

{{Infobox person | name = Stella Chinyelu Okoli | honorific_suffix = [[Order of the Niger|OON]], [[Orders, decorations, and medals of Nigeria|MON]] | image = <!-- filename only, no "File:" or "Image:" prefix, and no enclosing [[brackets]] --> | alt = <!-- descriptive text for use by the blind and visually impaired's speech synthesis (text-to-speech) software --> | caption = | birth_name = <!-- only use if different from name --> | birth_date = {{Birth year and age|1944||}} | birth_place = [[Kano State]], [[Nigeria]] | death_date = <!-- {{Death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} (death date then birth date) --> | death_place = | nationality = [[Nigerian]] | other_names = | alma_mater = {{plainlist| *[[University of Bradford]] *[[Chelsea College of Science and Technology|Chelsea College (University of London)]]}} | occupation = {{flatlist| *[[Pharmacist]] *[[entrepreneur]]}} | years_active = 1976–present | known_for = | notable_works = }}
'''Stella Chinyelu Okoli''' ([[Orders, decorations, and medals of Nigeria|MON]], [[Order of the Niger|OON]]) (born {{circa|1944}})<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thenationonlineng.net/stella-okoli-70/|title=Stella Okoli @70|work=[[The Nation (Nigeria)|The Nation Newspaper]]|date=6 August 2014|accessdate=3 February 2016}}</ref> is a [[Nigerian]] [[pharmacist]] and [[entrepreneur]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thenationonlineng.net/stella-okoli-in-low-70th-birthday-celebration/|title=Stella Okoli in low 70th birthday celebration|work=[[The Nation (Nigeria)|The Nation Newspaper]]|date=9 August 2014|accessdate=3 February 2016}}</ref> She is the founder and current C.E.O of [[Emzor Pharmaceutical]], a pharmaceutical manufacturing company.<ref name="ynaija">{{cite news|url=http://www.ynaija.com/men-and-women-of-excellence-full-list-of-nominees-for-the17th-thisday-annual-awards/|title=Women of distinction! Sefi Atta, Toyosi Akerele, Diezani Alison-Madueke, Florence It-Giwa & others to be honoured at the 17th ThisDay Annual Awards – See The Full List|work=[[YNaija]]|last=Inyang|first=Ifreke|date=3 February 2012|accessdate=3 February 2016}}</ref>
==Early life and education== Stella was born in [[Kano State]], [[Northern Nigeria]] into the family of Felix Ebelechukwu and Margaret Modebelu, descents of [[Nnewi]] in [[Anambra State]].<ref name="thisday"/> She started her [[formal education]] in 1954 after enrolling as a pupil at All Saint Primary School, [[Onitsha]] before proceeding to complete her [[Secondary education|secondary school education]] in 1964 at Ogidi Girls Secondary School, [[Ogidi, Anambra|Ogidi]].<ref name="thisday">{{cite news|url=http://www.thisdaylive.com/articles/stella-okoli-shocks-family-and-friends/187227|title=Stella Okoli Shocks Family and Friends|work=[[Thisday|ThisDay Newspaper]]|date=24 August 2014|accessdate=3 February 2016}}</ref>
In 1969, Stella graduated from the [[University of Bradford]] after studying [[Pharmacy]]. She also holds an M.Sc certificate in [[Biopharmaceutical]] after graduating from the [[University of London]], [[Chelsea College of Science and Technology|Chelsea College]] in 1971.<ref name="emerald">{{cite web|url=http://www.emeraldngr.com/documents/49.html|title=Profile of Dr. Stella Okoli|publisher=Emerald Energy Resources Limited|accessdate=3 February 2016}}</ref>
==Career== Prior to the establishment of [[Emzor Pharmaceutical]], Stella had worked in several pharmaceutical firms including [[Middlesex Hospital|Middlesex Hospital, London]], [[Boots UK|Boots the Chemists Limited]] and Pharma-Deko.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thestreetjournal.org/2011/09/meet-nigerias-most-influential-women/|title=Meet Nigeria’s Most Influential Women|publisher=The Street Journal|date=30 September 2011|accessdate=3 February 2016}}</ref>
In January 1977, Stella started Emzor Pharmaceutical with the initial name "Emzor Chemists Limited" as a small pharmacy retail shop in [[Somolu]], [[Lagos State]].<ref name="mirror">{{cite news|url=http://www.nationalmirroronline.net/new/nigerias-lady-of-drugs/|title=Nigeria’s ‘lady of drugs’|work=[[National Mirror|National Mirror Newspaper]]|last=Osunnuyi|first=Adejuwon|date=30 November 2015|accessdate=3 February 2016}}</ref> Emzor Pharmaceutical has since become one of the leading pharmaceutical companies in Nigeria with over 50 products since its incorporation in 1984.<ref name="mirror"/><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thenationonlineng.net/i-strive-to-make-people-happy/|title=‘I strive to make people happy’|work=[[The Nation (Nigeria)|The Nation Newspaper]]|date=12 October 2014|accessdate=3 February 2016}}</ref>
A current member of the Economic Summit of Nigeria and the Health Matters Advisory Board of Nigeria, Stella currently serves as the Vice President of Manufacturers Association of Nigeria and the Nigerian Association of Chambers of Commerce, Industry, Mines and Agriculture having served as Chairman of the Pharmaceutical Manufacturers Group and the Manufacturers Association of Nigeria.<ref name="emerald"/>
==Philanthropy== After the death of her son Chike Okoli in 2005, Stella started the Chike Okoli Foundation in 2006 as a [[Nonprofit organization|non-profit organisation]] founded with the aim of fighting poverty and diseases by raising awareness on [[cardiovascular diseases]]. She also runs the Chike Okoli Centre for Entrepreneurial Studies.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.venturesafrica.com/to-make-or-not-to-make-stella-okoli-emzor-pharmaceuticals/|title=To Make Or Not To Make: Stella Okoli, Emzor Pharmaceuticals|publisher=Ventures Africa|accessdate=3 February 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.vanguardngr.com/2012/06/why-we-fight-poverty-heart-diseases-stella-okoli-md-emzor/|title=Why we fight poverty, heart diseases – Stella Okoli, MD, Emzor|work=[[Vanguard (Nigeria)|Vanguard Newspaper]]|date=2 June 2012|last=Ayobami|first=John|accessdate=3 February 2016}}</ref>
==Accolades and recognitions== In recognition for her achievements and contributions to the health sector in Nigeria, Stella was bestowed with the [[Orders, decorations, and medals of Nigeria|Member of the Order of the Niger]] award. In 2012, she was honoured at the 17th [[Thisday|ThisDay]] Annual Awards.<ref name="ynaija"/> She is also a recipient of the ECOWAS International Gold Award.<ref name="mirror"/>
==References== {{Reflist|30em}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=May 2013}} {{Use British English|date=May 2013}} {{Infobox airport | name = Sywell Aerodrome | nativename = Northampton/Sywell Aerodrome | IATA = ORM | ICAO = EGBK | image= Sywell Aerodrome.jpg | type = Private | owner-oper = Sywell Aerodrome Ltd. | location = [[Northampton]] | city-served = [[Northampton]], [[Wellingborough]], [[Kettering]] and [[Rushden]] | elevation-f = 424 | coordinates = {{coord|52|18|22|N|000|47|32|W|type:airport_region:GB-NTH|display=inline,title}} | pushpin_map = Northamptonshire | pushpin_label = EGBK | pushpin_map_caption = Location in Northamptonshire | metric-rwy = yes | r1-number = 03R/21L | r1-length-m = 671 | r1-surface = [[Grass]] | r2-number = 05/23 | r2-length-m = 602 | r2-surface = Grass | r3-number = 03L/21R | r3-length-m = 1,258 | r3-surface = [[Concrete]] | footnotes = Sources: UK [[Aeronautical Information Publication|AIP]] at [[National Air Traffic Services|NATS]]<ref name="aip">{{cite web|url=http://www.nats-uk.ead-it.com/public/index.php%3Foption=com_content&task=blogcategory&id=106&Itemid=155.html|title=Northampton/Sywell - EGBK|publisher=}}</ref> }}
'''Sywell Aerodrome''' {{Airport codes|ORM|EGBK}} is the local aerodrome serving the town of [[Northampton]], [[Wellingborough]], [[Kettering]] and [[Rushden]], as well as wider Northamptonshire. The aerodrome is located {{Convert|5|NM|lk=in}} northeast of Northampton and was originally opened in 1928 on the edge of [[Sywell]] village.
The aerodrome caters for [[general aviation|private flying]], [[flight training]] and corporate flights. There is one fixed-wing flying school, one [[Ultralight aviation|microlight]] school and a helicopter school. The 1930s [[Art Deco]] hotel has bar and restaurant facilities. Aviation related industries and businesses are also located at the aerodrome.
Northampton (Sywell) Aerodrome has a [[United Kingdom Civil Aviation Authority|CAA]] Ordinary Licence (Number P496) that allows flights for the public transport of passengers or for flying instruction as authorised by the licensee (Sywell Aerodrome Limited).<ref>{{cite web | url= http://www.caa.co.uk/docs/375/srg_asd_ordinarylicences.pdf | format= PDF | publisher= [[Civil Aviation Authority (United Kingdom)|CAA]] SRG | title= Aerodrome Ordinary Licences | accessdate= 23 June 2007 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20070628053955/http://www.caa.co.uk/docs/375/srg_asd_ordinarylicences.pdf <!-- Bot retrieved archive --> |archivedate = 28 June 2007}}</ref>
A viewing area is provided for [[Aircraft spotting|aircraft spotters]].
==Second World War== The aerodrome opened in 1928 and during the [[Second World War]] the aerodrome as RAF Sywell, was used as a training facility ([[de Havilland Tiger Moth|Tiger Moth]]s) and later an important centre for the repair of [[Vickers Wellington|Wellington bombers]] and extensive sheds from this time still remain on the site. Among World War II pilots who underwent training at Sywell were [[Pierre Clostermann]]<ref>Clostermann, Pierre. The Big Show. London: Weidenfeld & Nicolson, 2004. {{ISBN|0-297-84619-1}}, p. 15</ref> and [[Paddy Finucane]], who soloed here.
Many aerial shots for the film [[Battle of Britain (film)|''Battle of Britain'']] were taken over the airport and nearby area.
==Expansion== Since 1999, the aerodrome sought planning permission for a hard runway, which was intended to allow operations to continue over the winter, when the grass runways often become waterlogged.<ref>{{cite news |title = Plans to improve aerodrome site | work = [[BBC News]] |date = 26 April 2006 |url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/northamptonshire/4937822.stm |accessdate = 24 August 2006}}</ref> The organisations STARE (Stop The Aerodrome Runway Expansion) and CPRE ([[Campaign to Protect Rural England]]) campaigned against this change, arguing that it would lead to more and larger aircraft flying over the area and disturb its "rural tranquility".<ref>{{cite news |title = £1m to sort out runway debate |work = Evening Telegraph |date = 14 August 2006 |url = http://www.ketteringtoday.co.uk/ViewArticle2.aspx?SectionID=661&ArticleID=1695015 |accessdate = 24 August 2006 }}</ref> Permission was granted for the runway on 22 November 2007 by the [[Department for Transport]], and though campaigners vowed to fight the decision<ref>{{cite news | url= http://www.northamptonchron.co.uk/news/Campaigners-fight-on-despite-Sywell39s.3513780.jp | date= 22 November 2007 | work= Northampton Chronicle & Echo | title= Campaigners fight on despite Sywell's runway approval | accessdate= 22 November 2007 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20071125071429/http://www.northamptonchron.co.uk/news/Campaigners-fight-on-despite-Sywell39s.3513780.jp <!-- Bot retrieved archive --> |archivedate = 25 November 2007}}</ref> they were unsuccessful and construction of the runway began in 2008. It opened during summer 2009 and enabled safe operations during the winter of 2009/2010 and onwards. In February 2010, the final inspection of the newly completed all-weather hard runway was carried out by the CAA who confirmed that it could be licensed for use.
== Operations == Sywell has three all-grass operational runways and a fourth all-weather concrete runway. The aerodrome's operational hours are 0900-1700 during winter and 0800-1700 during summer. The aerodrome offers an [[Flight Information Service|Aerodrome Flight Information Service]] to pilots.
[[File:AviationMuseum.JPG|thumb|left|Aviation Museum at Sywell]]
===Sywell Aviation Museum=== The aerodrome also houses the [[Sywell Aviation Museum]] dedicated to telling the wartime history of the site and the airmen that used it.
===Brooklands Flying Club=== Brooklands Flying Club<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.brooklandsflyingclub.co.uk|title=HOME|website=HOME}}</ref> was based at Sywell, with a fleet of four [[Aero AT-3]] aircraft and a [[Cessna 172]]. The club offered training for a [[Private Pilot's Licence]] (PPL), night rating and IMC rating.
The club opened in 2005 under the same name of the previous company that had been located on the airfield. The flying school closed down at the end of 2013.<ref>{{citation needed|date=July 2014}}</ref> The club has since reopened as 2Excel Training, operated in partnership with [[2Excel Aviation]], owners of [[The Blades (aerobatic team)|The Blades]] aerobatics team, who are also based at the airfield.
===Training=== Other flight training organisations on the airfield include: *Sloane Helicopters *Flylight Airsports
===The Blades=== [[The Blades (aerobatic team)|The Blades]] aerobatic display team are based at Sywell, where their five [[Extra EA-300]] aircraft are hangared.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theblades.com/Blades-corporate-homepage/Blades-corporate-site/Contact.aspx|title={title}|access-date=21 October 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303204154/http://www.theblades.com/Blades-corporate-homepage/Blades-corporate-site/Contact.aspx|archive-date=3 March 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> They perform aerobatic displays at major events around the country, in Europe, and in the Middle East.<ref>{{url=http://www.theblades.com/Blades-public-homepage/Blades-public-site/About/The-Display.aspx}}</ref> The team is the only one fully licensed by the CAA to carry paying 'passengers' in aerobatic displays, out of Sywell, or at many other locations.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theblades.com/Blades-public-homepage/Blades-public-site/Fly-with-The-Blades.aspx|title={title}|access-date=21 October 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160707002828/http://www.theblades.com/Blades-public-homepage/Blades-public-site/Fly-with-The-Blades.aspx|archive-date=7 July 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
===Sywell Airshow=== The aerodrome now hosts a bi-annual charity airshow<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sywellairshow.co.uk|title=Sywell Airshow|first=Handmade by Machine|last=Ltd|website=www.sywellairshow.co.uk}}</ref> in aid of the local [[Air Ambulance]] where there are many classic aircraft flying and on display such as the [[PBY Catalina|Catalina]], Mustang, [[T-6 Texan|North American Harvards]].
===Light Aircraft Association Rally=== The [[Light Aircraft Association]] (LAA - formerly the Popular Flying Association), is the UK's body for amateur aircraft construction, and recreational and sport flying. It used to hold its annual rally at [[Cranfield Airport]], and then at [[Kemble Airport]]. In 2006, the LAA lost so much money through poor attendances resulting from poor weather that in 2007 and 2008, much smaller (and cheaper) "regional rallies" were held. These were unpopular and in September 2009 a revived (if cut-down) LAA Rally was held at Sywell. This proved successful, and as further well-attended rallies took place at Sywell since<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.aviatoruk.ga/sywell-aerodrome/|title=Sywell Aerodrome EGBK/ORM - AviatorUK|publisher=|date=2017-09-09}}</ref>, the long-term future of the LAA Rally seems secure.
===Music in Flight=== [[Music in Flight]] is an airshow held at Sywell, in which an orchestra plays [[classical music]] to accompany flying aircraft, [[hot air balloon]]s, the [[Red Devils (Parachute Regiment)|Red Devils]] parachute display team and a fireworks display.
==Business park== An industrial area in the complex accommodates firms, agencies and other commercial businesses.
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== {{commons category}}
*[http://www.sywellaerodrome.co.uk/ Sywell Aerodrome] - official website *[http://www.sywellaerodrome.co.uk/museum.php Sywell Aviation Museum]

{{Infobox software | name = TaskCracker for Outlook | logo = | screenshot = | developer = TaskCracker | latest_release_version = 1.3.0 | latest_release_date = {{Start date and age|2015|01|29}} <ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.taskcracker.com/whats-new/ |title=TaskCracker for Outlook What's New page|publisher=TaskCracker |accessdate=August 7, 2014}}</ref> | status = Active | operating_system = [[Microsoft Windows]] | genre = [[Task management]] | license = [[Proprietary software|Proprietary]] | website = {{URL|www.taskcracker.com}} }}
'''TaskCracker for Outlook''' is a [[Microsoft Outlook]] add-in for [[task management|task]]- and [[time management|time-management]]. It allows managing tasks visually within Microsoft Outlook interface. It is based on the [[Time management#The Eisenhower Method|Eisenhower Method]] of arranging tasks by urgency and importance. It is also loosely based on [[David Allen (author)|David Allen]]'s [[Getting Things Done]] methodology of improving productivity.
== Features == '''TaskCracker for Outlook''' works with native Microsoft Outlook tasks and emails. <ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.softpedia.com/reviews/windows/TaskCracker-for-Outlook-Review-384957.shtml |title=Visual Task Management with TaskCracker for Outlook|publisher=Softpedia|accessdate=November 19, 2013}}</ref> * '''Visual task matrix''' with urgency and importance axis. This matrix is based on [[Time management#The Eisenhower Method|Eisenhower Method]] as well as [[Stephen Covey]]'s [[First Things First (book)|First Things First]] approach <ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.makeuseof.com/tag/manage-your-tasks-visually-with-taskcracker-for-outlook-giveaway/ |title=Manage Your Tasks Visually With TaskCracker For Outlook|publisher=Make Use Of|accessdate=November 19, 2013}}</ref> * '''[[Drag and drop]] tasks''' between quadrants to change both urgency and importance simultaneously * '''Filter tasks''' by categories, accounts etc. * '''Print matrix''' to have a hard copy * '''Colored categories''' to mark tasks and email from different projects
==References==
{{Reflist}}
== See also == * [[Time management#The Eisenhower Method|Eisenhower Method]] * [[Stephen Covey]] * [[First Things First (book)]] * [[Getting Things Done]] * [[Inbox Zero]]
[[Category:Task management software]] [[Category:Windows software]]

revision.text:
{{refimprove|date=August 2018}} {{Governance}}
'''Technology governance''' means the [[governance]], i.e., the [[steering]] between the different sectors—state, business, and [[Non-governmental organization|NGO]]s—of the development of [[technology]]. The concept is based on the notion of [[innovation]] and of techno-economic paradigm shifts according to the theories of [[Joseph Alois Schumpeter|Joseph A. Schumpeter]], [[Christopher Freeman]], [[Carlota Perez]], etc.
The idea is that certain periods in [[economic development]] are dominated by a paradigm-leading technology that influences through [[finance]] mechanisms, organizational change, greater returns, etc. Also, the economic and social sphere to such an extent that an entire [[paradigm]] is coined by them. Currently, that paradigm-leading technology is [[information and communications technology]] (ICT). According to Innovation Theory (and empirical findings as well), states, regions, or other communities do not automatically promote, or even go into, these key technologies, but rather need to be guided there by active [[wikt:intervene|intervention]], by the State sector (in close cooperation and coordination). Technology governance, (as a field of scholarly inquiry and academic instruction) is therefore about how this is theoretically and practically done, which [[institutions]] are optimal for such a venue, how the [[education]] of [[Academic administration|administrator]]s have to look like if they are going to have the administrative capacity to deal with such matters, etc.
Technology governance is a [[public policy]] concept; it is not to be confused with inner-corporate arrangements of organisation ([[corporate governance]]) and IT arrangements, sometimes called "Information Technology Governance".
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://hum.ttu.ee/tg/ Technology Governance website] at [[Tallinn University of Technology]] *https://www.igi-global.com/article/it-governance-in-higher-education-institutions/201171
[[Category:Economic development]] [[Category:Technology in society]] [[Category:Technological change]] [[Category:Innovation economics]]

{{other people|Thomas Terry}} [[File:Tomás Terry.jpg|thumbnail|Marble statue of Tomás Terry in the lobby of the Terry theatre, [[Cienfuegos]], [[Cuba]]; sculptor [[Tommaso Solari]]]]
'''Tomás Terry y Adán''' (24 February 1808 in [[Caracas]], [[Venezuela]] – 5 July 1886 in [[Paris]], [[France]])<ref name="thomas140">Thomas, p. 140</ref> was a [[Cuba]]n [[business magnate]].
==Family origins== Of [[Irish people|Irish]] paternal descent, Terry was born in Caracas to [[Spain|Spanish]]-born José Antonio Terry y Mendoza, who had settled in Venezuela from [[Cádiz]], and wife Tomasa Adán y España. Following the [[Cromwellian conquest of Ireland]], the Terrys had fled their hometown of [[Cork (city)|Cork]] for [[Catholic]] countries such as Spain, [[France]] and the states of the [[Italian peninsula]]. The Spanish branch, established in Cádiz and [[El Puerto de Santa María]], became involved in trade with the [[Spanish West Indies|Indies]] and [[Sherry]] production quite successfully, as in less than a decade from their arrival many of its members were knighted in the [[Order of Santiago]] and Guillermo Terry was granted the title of Marquis of la Cañada by King [[Philip V of Spain|Philip V]], on 8 September 1729.
==Life== [[File:Père-Lachaise - Division 92 - Terry y Dorticos 08.jpg|thumb|[[Père-Lachaise Cemetery]].]] Terry initially became involved in the [[slave trade]] in Cuba, making his first $10,000 by buying sick slaves, nursing them back to health, and then reselling them healthy for a large profit.<ref name="thomas137">Thomas, p. 137</ref> He bought the ''Caracas'' [[sugar mill]] for $23,000, and upgraded it to be the first in Cuba to use [[electricity]].<ref name="thomas137" /> He went on to make a fortune through involvement in all aspects of the economy, from the sugar trade and slave trade to banking and imports, becoming the dominant businessman in [[Cienfuegos]] and earning the nickname the "Cuban [[Croesus]]".<ref name="thomas140" /> His fortune grew to be among the largest in the world, with a net worth of about $725,000 in 1851, $3,090,00 in 1860, $7,890,000 in 1870, $13,760,000 in 1880, and over $25,000,000 at his death in 1886, which occurred in Paris, where he was buried in [[Père Lachaise Cemetery]] (division 92).<ref name="thomas140" />
==Descendants== [[File:"La marquesa de Perinat" (Raimundo Madrazo).JPG|thumbnail|Portrait of María del Carmen Terry, 1st Marchioness of Perinat by [[Raimundo Madrazo]]. [[Madrid]], [[Museo del Prado]].]] On 31 October 1837, Terry married Teresa Dorticós y Gómez de Leys, daughter of [[Andrés Dorticós]], a prominent local merchant and governor of Cienfuegos, and María del Carmen Gómez de Leys y La Puente.<ref>Thomas, p. 98</ref> They had 10 children:
*Tomás *Teresa *Andrés *María del Carmen, wife Guillermo Perinat y Ochoa, treasurer of the Royal Incomes. On 6 March 1893, she was granted of title of Marchioness of Perinat by Queen [[regent of Spain|Regent]] [[Maria Christina of Austria]] on the name of her son [[Alfonso XIII]]. She had two children: **Luis (1872–1923), married to Ana María de Elío y Gaztelu, 9th Marchioness of Campo Real, [[Grandee of Spain]] (1895–1964), with issue. **María Teresa (1875–1918), married to José Alfonso de Bustos y Ruiz de Arana, 3rd Duke of Andría, Grandee of Spain (1883–1940), without issue. *Eudardo *Juan Pedro *Francisco Javier (1850–1918). Married to Antonia Sánchez y Sarriá and had three children: **Natalia (1877–1962), married to French [[politician]] Count [[Stanislas de Castellane]] (1876–1959), younger brother of celebrated [[dandy]] [[Boni de Castellane]], with issue. **[[Emilio Terry|Emilio]] (1890–1969), famous [[architect]], [[interior decorator]] and [[landscape designer]]. **Odette, married to Prince Charles de La Tour d'Auvergne-Lauraguais (1877–1940), with issue. *José Emilio (1853–1911), [[Congress of Deputies (Spain)|deputy to Cortes]] for the province of [[Havana]] in 1886. Married to Silvia Alfonso-Aldama y Fonts, without issue. *María Natividad (1854–1928), married to [[Italy|Italian]] [[politician]] and [[diplomat]] Baron [[Alberto Blanc]] (1835–1904), [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Italy)|Minister of Foreign Affairs]] of the [[Kingdom of Italy]] from 1893 to 1896. They had three children: **Margherita (1884–1961), married [[Camillo Ruspoli, 2nd Prince of Candriano]] (1882–1949), without surviving issue. **Giovanni Alberto, Baron Blanc **Giulio (1891–1878), married to Lavinia Lante Montefeltro della Rovere (1904–1935), with issue. *Antonio (1857–1899), married firstly to [[US|American]] [[soprano]] [[Sybil Sanderson]] (1864–1903) and then to Grace Dalton-Secord (1860-1895). From his second marriage, he had a daughter. Correction: Sibyl Sanderson was Antonio Terry's second wife. Grace Dalton Secor was Antonio Terry's first wife. Antonio Terry and Grace Dalton Secor were married in 1876 in New York City and their daughter, Natividad Marta Maria Dolores Mercedes Terry, was born in 1881. She was Sibyl Sanderson's stepdaughter. The engagement of Sibyl Sanderson to Antonio Terry was announced in the New York Herald in August of 1894. **María Natividad (1882–1960), married to Prince Guy Charles de Faucigny-Lucinge et Coligny (1876–1914), great-grandson of [[Charles Ferdinand, Duke of Berry]] through his daughter Charlotte, Countess of Issoudun, bore by his mistress [[Amy Brown (royal mistress)|Amy Brown]] (with issue, including [[Anne-Aymone Giscard d'Estaing]]).
==Notes== {{reflist}} .
==References== * {{cite book | author = Hugh Thomas | title = Cuba, Or, The Pursuit of Freedom | publisher = Da Capo Press | year = 1998 | isbn = 0-306-80827-7}}

revision.text:
'''Volodymyr Satsyuk''' ({{Lang-uk|Володимир Сацюк}}) is the former deputy head of [[Ukraine]]’s intelligence agency. He is suspected of involvement in the poisoning of [[President of Ukraine|Ukrainian president]] [[Viktor Yushchenko]] in 2004.<ref name=Times>[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/europe/article6832223.ece ''President claims Kremlin is shielding his would-be killers'']</ref>
==Career== Satsyuk was a businessman before he joined the [[Security Service of Ukraine]], where he eventually became the Deputy Chairman.<ref name=ESSDR>[http://www.axisglobe.com/article.asp?article=1387 Eurasian Secret Services Daily Review]</ref>
==Allegations== Ukrainian prosecutors, after interviewing over 1,000 people, identified Satsyuk as being potentially involved in the poisoning of Yuschenko with [[dioxins and dioxin-like compounds|dioxin]].<ref name=Times/> Yushchenko had attended a private dinner on 5 September 2004 held at Satsyuk's residence,<ref>[http://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2009/4/30/94102.htm ''Справа про отруєння Ющенка: московський свідок заговорив'']</ref> during that year's Ukrainian presidential elections. He was accompanied by two assistants, [[Taras Zalessky]] and [[Alexei Poletukha]], the former vice-president of the [[JS Bank «Ukraine»]].<ref name=ESSDR/> According to ''[[The Times]]'' newspaper, "Ukraine’s pro-Russian government at the time was opposed to Yushchenko, fearing his pro-western tendencies and ambitions for Ukraine to join [[NATO]]." Satsyuk is currently in hiding in [[Moscow]], [[Russia]], where the government has given him [[Russian nationality law|Russian citizenship]], meaning he cannot be extradited for trial to another country.<ref name=Times/><ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/nation/49610 Yushchenko to Russia: Hand over witnesses], [[Kyiv Post]] (September 28, 2009)</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
